alert.note: Alert for Inland Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:17PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Lucie, southeastern Okeechobee and western Martin Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 617 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Buckhead Ridge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Treasure Island, Indiantown, Okeechobee, Four Seasons Estates and Taylor Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
